Takae Suju was a monk in Wa around 1357 DR.
Suju was the military instructor at Uwaji and a close collaborator of Baiyosho Degi. Takae, however, advocated for a more proactive role for the samurai in the countrys government, but this idea did not please the shogunate and he was reassigned to the isle of Huyusha to teach the prisoners at Ibhei.
Suju continued his studies on government reform and wrote many unpublished books about it.
